page.title: 11TRANSLATION OF PAGE 10
page.content: There was a large number of people in the old times speaking Welsh. Most of the people worked in Rhiw goch,Moel Faen,a clogau, and also some worked on the farms.The language of the school was English and in 1920 there were 50-70 pupils but by 1950 the number had dropped to 20.Today there are approximately 35 children. A number of people have come to live here and some new houses have been built.The community life changed, in years gone by people where helping each other especially on the farms. Religious worship has changed, in 1919 there where 20 children in Llandynan Sunday School and 20 in Rhewl Sunday School.Today Llandynan chapel has closed and Rhewl has only got 10.
